Name: C1_School closing
Description: Record closings of schools and universities

Name: C2_Workplace closing
Description: Record closings of workplaces

Name: C3_Cancel public events
Description: Record cancelling public events

Name: C4_Restrictions on gatherings
Description: Record limits on gatherings

Name: C5_Close public transport
Description: Record closing of public transport

Name: C6_Stay at home requirements
Description: Record orders to "shelter-in-place" and otherwise confine to the home

Name: C7_Restrictions on internal movement
Description: Record restrictions on internal movement between cities/regions

Name: C8_International travel controls
Description:
Record restrictions on international travel

Note: this records policy for foreign travellers, not citizens

Name:
E1_Income support`
(for households)
Description:
Record if the government is providing direct cash payments to people who lose their jobs or cannot work.

Note: only includes payments to firms if explicitly linked to payroll/salaries

Name: E1_Flag
Type: formal sector workers only or informal sector workers only

Name:
E2_Debt/contract relief`
(for households)
Description: Record if the government is freezing financial obligations for households (eg stopping loan repayments, preventing services like water from stopping, or banning evictions)

Name: H1_Public information campaigns
Description: Record presence of public info campaigns

Name: H2_Testing policy
Description:
Record government policy on who has access to testing

Note: this records policies about testing for current infection (PCR tests) not testing for immunity (antibody test)

Name: H3_Contact tracing
Description:
Record government policy on contact tracing after a positive diagnosis

Note: we are looking for policies that would identify all people potentially exposed to Covid-19; voluntary bluetooth apps are unlikely to achieve this

Name: H6_Facial Coverings
Description: Record policies on the use of facial coverings outside the home

Name: H7_Vaccination Policy
Description: Record policies for vaccine delivery for different groups

Name: H7_Flag
Type: At cost to individual (or funded by NGO, insurance, or partially government funded)

Name: H8_Protection of elderly people
Description: Record policies for protecting elderly people (as defined locally) in Long Term Care Facilities and/or the community and home setting

Name: V3_Vaccine financial support (summary)
Description: Reports the overall approach taken to vaccine funding – whether paid by the individual or the government

Name: C1_School closing
Description: Record closings of schools and universities
Type: recommend closing or all schools open with alterations resulting in significant differences compared to non

Name: C2_Workplace closing
Description: Record closings of workplaces
Type: recommend closing (or recommend work from home) or all businesses open with alterations resulting in significant differences compared to non

Name: C3_Cancel public events
Description: Record cancelling public events

Name: C4_Restrictions on gatherings
Description: Record limits on gatherings
Type: restrictions on very large gatherings (the limit is above 1000 people)

Name: C5_Close public transport
Description: Record closing of public transport
Type: recommend closing (or significantly reduce volume/route/means of transport available)

Name: C6_Stay at home requirements
Description: Record orders to "shelter-in-place" and otherwise confine to the home

Name: C7_Restrictions on internal movement
Description: Record restrictions on internal movement between cities/regions
Type: recommend not to travel between regions/cities

Name: C8_International travel controls
Description:
Record restrictions on international travel

Note: this records policy for foreign travellers, not citizens

Name:
E1_Income support`
(for households)
Description:
Record if the government is providing direct cash payments to people who lose their jobs or cannot work.

Note: only includes payments to firms if explicitly linked to payroll/salaries
Type: government is replacing less than 50% of lost salary (or if a flat sum, it is less than 50% median salary)

Name:
E2_Debt/contract relief`
(for households)
Description: Record if the government is freezing financial obligations for households (eg stopping loan repayments, preventing services like water from stopping, or banning evictions)
Type: narrow relief, specific to one kind of contract

Name: E3_Fiscal measures
Description:
Announced economic stimulus spending

Note: only record amount additional to previously announced spending

Name: E4_International support
Description:
Announced offers of Covid-19 related aid spending to other countries

Note: only record amount additional to previously announced spending

Name: H1_Public information campaigns
Description: Record presence of public info campaigns
Type: public officials urging caution about Covid

Name: H2_Testing policy
Description:
Record government policy on who has access to testing

Note: this records policies about testing for current infection (PCR tests) not testing for immunity (antibody test)
Type: only those who both (a) have symptoms AND (b) meet specific criteria (eg key workers, admitted to hospital, came into contact with a known case, returned from overseas)

Name: H3_Contact tracing
Description:
Record government policy on contact tracing after a positive diagnosis

Note: we are looking for policies that would identify all people potentially exposed to Covid-19; voluntary bluetooth apps are unlikely to achieve this
Type: limited contact tracing; not done for all cases

Name: H4_Emergency investment in healthcare
Description:
Announced short term spending on healthcare system, eg hospitals, masks, etc

Note: only record amount additional to previously announced spending

Name: H5_Investment in vaccines
Description:
Announced public spending on Covid-19 vaccine development

Note: only record amount additional to previously announced spending

Name: H6_Facial Coverings
Description: Record policies on the use of facial coverings outside the home

Name: H7_Vaccination Policy
Description: Record policies for vaccine delivery for different groups
Type: Availability for ONE of following: key workers/ clinically vulnerable groups (non elderly) / elderly groups

Name: H7_Flag
Type: No or minimal cost to individual (government funded or subsidised)

Name: H8_Protection of elderly people
Description: Record policies for protecting elderly people (as defined locally) in Long Term Care Facilities and/or the community and home setting
Type: Recommended isolation, hygiene, and visitor restriction measures in LTCFs and/or elderly  people to stay at home

Name: V1_Vaccine prioritisation (summary)
Description: Reports the existence of a prioritised plan for vaccine rollout

Name: C1_School closing
Description: Record closings of schools and universities
Type: require closing (only some levels or categories, eg just high school, or just public schools)

Name: C2_Workplace closing
Description: Record closings of workplaces
Type: require closing (or work from home) for some sectors or categories of workers

Name: C3_Cancel public events
Description: Record cancelling public events

Name: C4_Restrictions on gatherings
Description: Record limits on gatherings

Name: C5_Close public transport
Description: Record closing of public transport
Type: require closing (or prohibit most citizens from using it)

Name: C6_Stay at home requirements
Description: Record orders to "shelter-in-place" and otherwise confine to the home
Type: require not leaving house with exceptions for daily exercise, grocery shopping, and 'essential' trips

Name: C7_Restrictions on internal movement
Description: Record restrictions on internal movement between cities/regions

Name: C8_International travel controls
Description:
Record restrictions on international travel

Note: this records policy for foreign travellers, not citizens
Type: quarantine arrivals from some or all regions

Name:
E1_Income support`
(for households)
Description:
Record if the government is providing direct cash payments to people who lose their jobs or cannot work.

Note: only includes payments to firms if explicitly linked to payroll/salaries
Type: government is replacing 50% or more of lost salary (or if a flat sum, it is greater than 50% median salary)

Name:
E2_Debt/contract relief`
(for households)
Description: Record if the government is freezing financial obligations for households (eg stopping loan repayments, preventing services like water from stopping, or banning evictions)

Name: E3_Fiscal measures
Description:
Announced economic stimulus spending

Note: only record amount additional to previously announced spending

Name: E4_International support
Description:
Announced offers of Covid-19 related aid spending to other countries

Note: only record amount additional to previously announced spending

Name: H1_Public information campaigns
Description: Record presence of public info campaigns
Type: coordinated public information campaign (eg across traditional and social media)

Name: H2_Testing policy
Description:
Record government policy on who has access to testing

Note: this records policies about testing for current infection (PCR tests) not testing for immunity (antibody test)

Name: H3_Contact tracing
Description:
Record government policy on contact tracing after a positive diagnosis

Note: we are looking for policies that would identify all people potentially exposed to Covid-19; voluntary bluetooth apps are unlikely to achieve this
Type: comprehensive contact tracing; done for all identified cases

Name: H4_Emergency investment in healthcare
Description:
Announced short term spending on healthcare system, eg hospitals, masks, etc

Note: only record amount additional to previously announced spending

Name: H5_Investment in vaccines
Description:
Announced public spending on Covid-19 vaccine development

Note: only record amount additional to previously announced spending

Name: H6_Facial Coverings
Description: Record policies on the use of facial coverings outside the home
Type: Required in some specified shared/public spaces outside the home with other people present, or some situations when social distancing not possible

Name: H7_Vaccination Policy
Description: Record policies for vaccine delivery for different groups
Type: Availability for TWO of following: key workers/ clinically vulnerable groups (non elderly) / elderly groups

Name: H8_Protection of elderly people
Description: Record policies for protecting elderly people (as defined locally) in Long Term Care Facilities and/or the community and home setting
Type: Narrow restrictions for isolation, hygiene in LTCFs, some limitations on external visitors and/or restrictions protecting elderly people at home

Name: C1_School closing
Description: Record closings of schools and universities

Name: C2_Workplace closing
Description: Record closings of workplaces
Type: require closing (or work from home) for all

Name: C3_Cancel public events
Description: Record cancelling public events

Name: C4_Restrictions on gatherings
Description: Record limits on gatherings

Name: C5_Close public transport
Description: Record closing of public transport

Name: C6_Stay at home requirements
Description: Record orders to "shelter-in-place" and otherwise confine to the home
Type: require not leaving house with minimal exceptions (eg allowed to leave once a week, or only one person can leave at a time, etc)

Name: C7_Restrictions on internal movement
Description: Record restrictions on internal movement between cities/regions

Name: C8_International travel controls
Description:
Record restrictions on international travel

Note: this records policy for foreign travellers, not citizens

Name:
E1_Income support`
(for households)
Description:
Record if the government is providing direct cash payments to people who lose their jobs or cannot work.

Note: only includes payments to firms if explicitly linked to payroll/salaries

Name: H1_Public information campaigns
Description: Record presence of public info campaigns

Name: H2_Testing policy
Description:
Record government policy on who has access to testing

Note: this records policies about testing for current infection (PCR tests) not testing for immunity (antibody test)
Type: open public testing (eg "drive through" testing available to asymptomatic people)

Name: H6_Facial Coverings
Description: Record policies on the use of facial coverings outside the home
Type: Required in all shared/public spaces outside the home with other people present or all situations when social distancing not possible

Name: H7_Vaccination Policy
Description: Record policies for vaccine delivery for different groups
Type: Availability for ALL of following: key workers/ clinically vulnerable groups (non elderly) / elderly groups

Name: H8_Protection of elderly people
Description: Record policies for protecting elderly people (as defined locally) in Long Term Care Facilities and/or the community and home setting
Type: Extensive restrictions for isolation and hygiene in LTCFs, all non
